title: Andy Ruiz Jr shows off knockout POWER after knocking trainer's glove off ahead of AJ rematch
text:
World heavyweight champion Andy Ruiz Jr showed off his knockout power on Instagram after sharing a video of his latest training session.

Ruiz Jr is in camp ahead of his much anticipated rematch with Anthony Joshua in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia on December 7.

The Mexican uploaded a video on Sunday showing him undergoing a pad session with trainer Manny Robles during which he knocks Robles' pad off his hand.

Andy Ruiz Jr showed off his knockout power with a video of some explosive pad work

One of the heavyweight's shots sent trainer Manny Robles' pad flying off his hand

Ruiz Jr's face spread into a satisfying smile after watching the pad go flying across the canvas

Ruiz Jr unloads several big shots with both hands before his final blow sends the pad flying across the canvas, resulting in a satisfied smile from the heavyweight.

The 30-year-old released multiple clips of his training sessions, one of which sees him getting a sweat on as he runs through a wooded area.

The California-based fighter has considerable weight to shift after appearing to pile on the pounds in the aftermath of his win over Joshua in June.

Ruiz Jr stunned Joshua with a seventh round TKO victory and spent the following months enjoying the fruits of his night's work.

His own trainer, Robles, admitted recently that the WBO, WBA, IBF and IBO world champion was in poor physical condition and had done little training before agreeing to a rematch.

Ruiz Jr weighed in at 268 lbs (19 stone, 1 pound), prior to his first bout with Joshua but has claimed he will weigh in considerably lighter for their second fight.

His target weight of 255 lbs means he could enter the ring in Saudi Arabia over a stone lighter as he bids to be the faster fighter on the night.
description: The heavyweight uploaded a video on Sunday showing him undergoing a pad session with trainer Manny Robles during which he sends Robles' pad flying off his hand and across the canvas.
